required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic Testing in Predicting Biomarkers of Recurrence in Patients With Prostate Cancer Undergoing Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Pre-Surgical EPS Biomarkers as Predictors of Biochemical Recurrence

brief_summary.textblock: This trial studies the side effects and best way to perform genetic testing in predicting biomarkers of recurrence in patients with prostate cancer undergoing surgery. Collecting and storing samples of tissue, blood, and other body fluids from patients to test in the laboratory and collecting information about the patient's health and treatment may help doctors learn more about cancer and help predict the recurrence of prostate cancer

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVES: I. To explore the performance of these models in predicting the likelihood of biochemical recurrence (BCR).
SECONDARY OBJECTIVES: I. To explore the performance of these models in predicting upgrading and upstaging prior to surgery. II. To explore the performance of these models in improving risk stratification among patients eligible for active surveillance. III. To determine whether prostatic massage or surgery raises the count of circulating tumor cells (CTC) in post-digital rectal exam (DRE) blood specimens.
OUTLINE: Patients receive prostatic massage and undergo a digital rectal exam (DRE). Laboratory assessments are performed and blood samples are collected for molecular biology testing. On the day of the scheduled prostatectomy, a second blood collection is performed prior to surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Performance of these models in predicting the likelihood of BCR
primary_outcome.description: Logistic regression and artificial neural networks will be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the performance in these models in predicting upgrading and upstaging prior to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Logistic regression and artificial neural networks will be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the performance of these models in improving risk stratification among patients eligible for active surveillance
secondary_outcome.description: Logistic regression and artificial neural networks will be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination whether prostatic massage or surgery raises the count of circulating tumor cells (CTCs) in post-DRE blood specimens
secondary_outcome.description: Logistic regression and artificial neural networks will be used.

arm_group.description: Patients receive prostatic massage and undergo a digital rectal examination. Laboratory assessments are performed and blood samples are collected for molecular biology testing. On the day of the scheduled prostatectomy, a second blood collection is performed prior to surgery.

intervention.description: Performed on Post-massage urine (PMU) and/or expressed prostatic secretions (EPS) samples obtained at the time of surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All men undergoing robotic prostatectomy or cystoprostatectomy at City of Hope will be eligible for the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Men who undergo neoadjuvant treatment with Androgen Deprivation Therapy (ADT) or salvage prostatectomy including those who have had brachytherapy will be excluded
